required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Titanium-nitric Oxide-coated Stent (Optimax®) in Patients With Lesions With a Low Risk of Restenosis (Diameter ≥ 3.0 mm and Length ≤ 20 mm)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicenter and Observational Registry for the Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Titanium-nitric Oxide-coated Stent (Optimax®) in Patients With Lesions With a Low Risk of Restenosis (Diameter ≥ 3.0 mm and Length ≤ 20 mm) (Reto 320 Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective registry is intended to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Optimax® stent.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective registry is intended to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Optimax® stent in de novo coronary lesions with reference diameter ≥ 3.0 mm and Length ≤ 20 mm.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety. The number of composite events of cardiac.
primary_outcome.description: The number of composite events of cardiac death, myocardial infarction (MI) and stent thrombosis (Academic Research Consortium definitive/probable).

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy: Incidence of clinically driven target lesion revascularization (TLR).
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of clinically driven target lesion revascularization (TLR).Defined as any repeat percutaneous intervention of the target lesion or bypass surgery of the target vessel performed for restenosis or other complication of the target lesion.

intervention.description: Percutaneous coronary intervention with Optimax stent®

study_pop.textblock: Patients with de novo coronary lesion treated with Optimax® stent, reference diameter = 3.0 mm and length ≤ 20 mm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with age ≥ 18 years old.
- Patients with de novo coronary lesion treated with Optimax® stent, reference diameter = 3.0 mm and length ≤ 20 mm.
- Informed consent signed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of the patient to participate at the study.
- Treatment of other injuries that do not meet the conditions (3x20).

results_reference.citation: López-Mínguez JR, Nogales-Asensio JM, Romani S, Rivero-Crespo F, Aragón-Extremera VM, Jiménez-Mazuecos JM, Carrasco F, Oteo-Domínguez JF, Bosa-Ojeda F, Gómez-Hospital JA. Catheter Cardiovasc Interv. 2018 Aug 1;92(2):261-268. doi: 10.1002/ccd.27326. Epub 2017 Sep 30.
